author: IGN
description:
Palia reviewed by Travis Northup on PC, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 5, also available on Nintendo Switch.

Palia is a fantastic multiplayer cozy life sim with strong characters to bond with, engaging activities to grind, and a nearly endless chase for more resources to build your perfect home in the world’s kindest village. I wouldn’t have guessed that the cozy sensibilities of Animal Crossing would mix well with the online design of an MMO, but it’s difficult to pull myself away from setting off fireworks with friends and helping the bumbling mayor find his misplaced sandwich, even after more than 70 hours. There’s still plenty of room for Palia to grow, whether it’s the surprisingly brief story we’re gotten thus far, a scarcity of multiplayer-focused activities to engage with, and enough bugs and performance issues to put a not-so-cuddly fly in the otherwise soothing ointment, but it’s still a great candidate for your next virtual vacation.
title: Palia Review

author: IGN
description:
Ratshaker, the comedic first-person pest-control simulator, is on the way to PS5 on May 28 – complete with gyro-based DualSense controller features. For the first time ever, you can physically shake your controller to shake the rat — it’s absurd, satisfying, and strangely therapeutic. "Your rat responds to every shake... sometimes unexpectedly," developer Sunscorched Studios says. Check it out on the Sony store if you're interested: https://store.playstation.com/concept/10014682

#IGN #Gaming
title: Ratshaker: Official PS5 Trailer

description:
Ethan Hunt and the IMF have faced off against super villains and super computers. They've stolen classified data and biological weapons, averted nuclear disaster, global chaos and everything in between. author: IGN
description:
Check out this clip from the new season of Long Way Home. The series features Ewan McGregor and Charley Boorman. Long Way Home is streaming now on Apple TV+. 

Long Way Home follows Ewan and Charley as they ride refurbished vintage motorbikes from Ewan’s home in Scotland to Charley’s in England — but rather than take the shortest route, they go the long way! They head across the North Sea to Scandinavia, all the way up to the Arctic Circle and then down to the Baltics and through continental Europe, before eventually hopping back over the English Channel two months later. It’s an adventure that will take them to more than fifteen countries, through spectacular scenery and along some of the greatest driving roads in the world. Along the way they’ll immerse themselves in each country’s culture, meet the locals and try their hand at unique and eclectic activities.

The Emmy Award-nominated series is executive produced by Ewan McGregor and Charley Boorman, alongside longtime collaborators
title: Long Way Home - Official 'Viking Experience' Clip (2025) Ewan McGregor, Charley Boorman

author: IGN
description:
In this snippet from podcast Beyond 897, Jada chatted with Sea of Stars creative director Thierry Boulanger about the upcoming DLC, Throes of the Watchmaker. 

Check out the full episode here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MriNC-z6K_Y

***
For thousands of years (or at least since the 90s) PlayStation has been pushing the boundaries of the video game medium. For almost as long, Beyond has been along for the ride. Join a panel of passionate playstation experts and enthusiasts including Max Scoville, Brian Altano, Jada Griffin and company. Each week we unpack the latest gaming news, gush about what we’re playing, chat with developers and voice actors and explore the ever-expanding world of PlayStation - and Beyond! Catch a new episode every Wednesday on IGN, YouTube or wherever you get your podcasts.

This week’s show is Max Scoville, Jada Griffin, Nick Limon and is produced by Nick Maillet
title: How Sea of Stars New Free DLC pays homage to Final Fantasy 6 & More - Beyond Clips

author: IGN
description:
Doom. Four letters, two gun barrels, one space marine and boatloads of demon guts is all it takes to change the face of gaming forever. At IGN, we've put together a list of our top DOOM games ranked. 

Doom: The Dark Ages is finally out, but how does it compare to the likes of Doom 1993, Doom 3, or even Doom 2016? How does the DOOM Classic series compare to the black sheep of the series, Doom 3? And is the revival series of Doom 2016, Doom Eternal, or Doom: The Dark Ages the best among the best? We sat down and put together our ranking of every DOOM game from best to worst!

00:00 - Intro
00:55 - 7: DOOM 3
03:56 - 6: DOOM 64
05:43 - 5: DOOM 2
08:30 - 4: DOOM: The Dark Ages
10:32 - 3...
13:08 - 2...
15:35 - DOOM Wads + Mods
16:32 - 1...
19:29 - Outro

#IGN #Gaming #DOOM #DOOMTheDarkAges
title: Ranking Doom Games from WORST to BEST

description:
Doom: The Dark Ages is the newest entry in the legendary Doom series, renowned for its challenging combat and well-hidden secrets. In this Doom: The Dark Ages collectibles video guide, we will show you where to find every collectible. Follow along and reveal every gold piece, ruby, codex, demonic essence upgrade, weapon skin, toy, and secret area.

Don’t miss the armor upgrade, yellow key, or secret areas in Chapter 9, Ancestral Forge! For more Doom: The Dark Ages tips and strategies, head to IGN for our full Wiki guide at https://www.ign.com/wikis/doom-the-dark-ages

author: IGN
description:
Monster Train 2 reviewed on PC by Dan Stapleton. Also available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S (on Game Pass), PC, and Nintendo Switch.
Monster Train 2 is a fantastic upgrade for what was already one of the best deckbuilding roguelites out there. Its new Equipment cards layer on even more ways to build a team of super-powerful monsters, and its five new clans of delightfully weird characters are every bit as ripe for experimentation and unexpected results as the original cast. You can play it dozens of times and not take the same approach twice – and even if you choose the same starting options you have to adapt and think on your feet to make the most of what fate decides to give you. I can easily say right now that its endless challenge and the pleasant surprises I’m still discovering within it will keep me coming back for hundreds of hours.
title: Monster Train 2 Review
